title: Scripts do not properly use specified contract
body: ### Component Forge ### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date? - [X] Foundry - [X] Foundryup ### What version of Foundry are you on? forge 0.2.0 (2e18681 2023-06-26T00:15:26.624789000Z) ### What command(s) is the bug in? forge script ### Operating System macOS (Apple Silicon) ### Describe the bug There seems to be an issue with contracts that have the same name when running `forge script` We have the following repo: https://github.com/bgd-labs/aave-proposals Where we have our contracts in this format: `src/ProjectName/Contract.sol:Contract` We also have a `Makefile` with the following script: `deploy-ledger :; forge script ${contract} --rpc-url ${chain} $(if ${dry},--sender 0x25F2226B597E8F9514B3F68F00f494cF4f286491 -vvvv,--broadcast --ledger --mnemonics foo --mnemonic-indexes ${MNEMONIC_INDEX} --sender ${LEDGER_SENDER} --verify -vvvv)` When running `make deploy-ledger` and specifying a certain `${contract}, forge instead seems to find the first iteration it can find of `Contract.sol:Contract` and because only `src/PROJECT_NAME_IS_UNIQUE/Contract.sol:Contract` the project name might change, it seems it's deploying the first contract as can be seen in the attached screenshot. While we're running with path `src/AaveV3StrategicAssets_20230622/DeployProposal.sol:SinglePayloadProposal` and it looks as Make is getting that command to run correctly, the issue happens later on Foundry as can be seen on line `VM::ffi` where it's getting the information from `src/AaveV3OPEmode_20230622` Tried to replicate with a new project was unable to get it to do the same thing. Thank you.
